comments:
M5.

I created an editor plug-in in Eclipse 2.1.2 using the PDE new project 
support.  This simple xml editor does not work in Eclipse 3.0 (class not found 
org.eclipse.jface.text.source.SourceViewerConfiguration).

The problem is in InternalPlatform.fixRequiredPlugins().

The newUIPluginIds list refers to "org.eclipse.ui.jface.text".  This is 
erroneous and should be "org.eclipse.jface.text".  Once I made this change and 
discarded my metadata, the 2.1.2 plug-in worked!

updated severity.  I believe we should make a patch for this for those who are 
checking to ensure that there plug-ins are compatable.

Created an attachment (id=6966)
new runtime.jar

Here is a new runtime jar with the fix.

I have tested the fix based on John's steps above. (created an editor in 2.1.2
which failed in 3.0 then replaced the jar and it worked)

steps:
- put the attached jar into /eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.0.0
- delete the registry cache file (workspace/.metadata/.registry)
- start Eclipse

Created an attachment (id=6967)
patch

Here is a patch file for the org.eclipse.update.configurator project.

Moving to Platform/Update to release the code into HEAD. (plugin.xml legacy
convertor code is now in the update.configurator project)

Are you sure you put the new jar in the correct location? 

What does your plugin.xml file look like for the runtime plugin?

The jar works for me with a M5 build and I have verified that the
InternalPlatform class is inside the jar.

DJ, I checked in the patch from comment #3. I could not test it yet, as I am 
not setup for the new runtime.

Yes, I am quite sure. I retested again on a second computer. I unzipped a 
fresh installation of M5 and put the runtime.jar into eclipse-SDK-3.0M5-win32
\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.0.0, replacing the original 
runtime.jar. My plugin.xml contains

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?eclipse version="3.0"?>
<plugin
  name="%pluginName"
  id="org.eclipse.core.runtime"
  version="3.0"
  provider-name="%providerName">

  <runtime>
    <library name="runtime.jar">
      <export name="*"/>
      <packages prefixes="org.eclipse.core"/>
    </library>
  </runtime>

  <extension-point name="%applicationsName" id="applications" 
schema="schema/applications.mxsd"/>
  <extension-point name="%handlersName" id="urlHandlers" 
schema="schema/urlHandlers.mxsd"/>

</plugin>

The InternalPlatform class is in my jar, too. Seems to be a class loader 
problem?

Created an attachment (id=6982)
recreated runtime.jar

Solved it. This seems to be a JAR incompatability. I solved it by extracting
and recreating the runtime.jar. FYI: I am using the Sun Java 2 SDK 1.4.2-b28.

I can confirm that with the recreated runtime.jar, the problem goes away for
me. 

I am attaching the recreated runtime.jar.

the Manifest was "out" ...

i take the old one and put it in the new jar and now it's works :)
Is there anything else expected to be fixed or we can close this bug?

Ok to close for now. 
If something else comes up we'll open another bug report. 
Thanks.
